Package clientGUIControllers

Class PopUpController

java.lang.Object
clientGUIControllers.PopUpController
public class PopUpController extends Object
This class is used to control the behavior of a pop-up window. It includes methods to set the title and message of the pop-up, as well as an ImageView and a link to the next screen. It also includes methods to handle the 'X' and 'OK' buttons being pressed, which will close the pop-up window and navigate to the specified screen.

  • Method Details

    • Xpressed

      void Xpressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the 'X' button is pressed. It closes the current window and navigates to the screen specified in the linkToScreen field.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggers the method.

    • okPressed

      void okPressed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the 'OK' button is pressed. It closes the current window and navigates to the screen specified in the linkToScreen field.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggers the method.

    • setTitleAndMessage

      public void setTitleAndMessage(String title, String message)
      This method sets the title and message of the pop-up window.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the pop-up window.
      message - The message of the pop-up window.

    • seImageView

      public void seImageView(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      This method sets the image in the imageView of the pop-up window.
      Parameters:
      image - The image that should be displayed in the pop-up window.

    • setLinkToScreen

      public void setLinkToScreen(String linkToScreen)
      The method setLinkToScreen sets the screen that the user should be directed to after closing the pop-up window or pressing OK.
      Parameters:
      linkToScreen - The FXML file path of the screen that the user should be directed to after closing the pop-up window or pressing OK.

    • setEventToClose

      public void setEventToClose(javafx.event.ActionEvent eventToClose)
      The method setEventToClose sets the event that should be used to close the current pop-up window.
      Parameters:
      eventToClose - The event that should be used to close the current pop-up window.
